column1: Abu kabir (Egyptian Arabic: أبو كبير‎) is a city in the Sharqia Governorate of Egypt.
Successive census results indicate a considerable steady rise in its population - 68
Abu Kebir is a city located in Al Sharkia Governorate in the north of Egypt
column2: 80km from Cairo capital. Among its figures are chemist Mostafa El-Sayed [1] and football player Ahmed Salama.

column1: It's well known for its rural suburbs with some distinctive agricultural crops as well as the urban area and markets in the city center.
Köppen-Geiger climate classification system classifies its climate as hot desert (BWh).
